instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
on <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> i got 5v on 1,2,3 leg rest 0v i don't have proper brd because got only for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 
J8300
all legs 0v
only leg 3 got 5.04

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
Check for USB activity.
Do you hear the startup chime?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message: yes there is chime ,  mac start normaly

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
Confirm USB activity, or Caps Lock reaction.
Need to be sure board doesn't get stuck after chime.
